meta.notes: v2.3: Added syllableDivisionPriority meta field and VCCCV syllable division concept rule (apply before VCCV).
meta.highlightFormat: example.highlight is an object: {type:'token'|'split'|'span'|'none', ...}. 'split' uses indices for split digraph like a_e. 'none' means no explicit highlight.
meta.breakdownFormat: example.breakdown is a string joined by unitSeparator
meta.syllableFormat: Optional: example.syllables is an array of syllable strings; each syllable string is joined by unitSeparator. Suggested display joiner: '/'.

categories.name_cn: 长元音字母组合 Vowel Teams
其他元音组合（双元音/变体元音）
软音 C/G 与 Y 的多种用法
常见词尾变化（语法词尾）
六大音节类型（读多音节词的规则）
弱读音 Schwa（非重读音节）
音节划分规则（多音节拆分）
辅音清浊变化（发音倾向）

tts.en: Letter b: most commonly says /b/. Examples: bat, bed, big, bug.
tts.zh: 字母 b：最常见发音 /b/。例词：bat，bed，big，bug。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母 c 硬音 /k/（常在 a,o,u 前）

tts.en: Letter c: most commonly says /k/. Examples: cat, cap, cot, cup.
tts.zh: 字母 c：最常见发音 /k/。例词：cat，cap，cot，cup。

notes: Most common sound (hard c).
When c is followed by e, i, or y, it often says /s/ — see consonant.soft_c.

tts.en: Letter d: most commonly says /d/. Examples: dog, dad, dip, duck.
tts.zh: 字母 d：最常见发音 /d/。例词：dog，dad，dip，duck。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter f: most commonly says /f/. Examples: fan, fig, fun, fox.
tts.zh: 字母 f：最常见发音 /f/。例词：fan，fig，fun，fox。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母 g 硬音 /g/（常在 a,o,u 前）

tts.en: Letter g: most commonly says /g/. Examples: gap, got, gum, tag.
tts.zh: 字母 g：最常见发音 /g/。例词：gap，got，gum，tag。

notes: Most common sound (hard g).
When g is followed by e, i, or y, it often says /dʒ/ — see consonant.soft_g.
Sometimes a silent u is used to keep g hard (gu) — see consonant.digraph.gu_hard_g.

tts.en: Letter h: most commonly says /h/. Examples: hat, hen, him, hot.
tts.zh: 字母 h：最常见发音 /h/。例词：hat，hen，him，hot。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母 j 常见音 /dʒ/（像中文“j”）

tts.en: Letter j: most commonly says /dʒ/. Examples: jam, jet, jog, jump.
tts.zh: 字母 j：最常见发音 /dʒ/。例词：jam，jet，jog，jump。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter k: most commonly says /k/. Examples: kit, kick, keg, sock.
tts.zh: 字母 k：最常见发音 /k/。例词：kit，kick，keg，sock。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter l: most commonly says /l/. Examples: lip, leg, log, lamp.
tts.zh: 字母 l：最常见发音 /l/。例词：lip，leg，log，lamp。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter m: most commonly says /m/. Examples: map, men, mix, mud.
tts.zh: 字母 m：最常见发音 /m/。例词：map，men，mix，mud。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter n: most commonly says /n/. Examples: nap, net, nip, nut.
tts.zh: 字母 n：最常见发音 /n/。例词：nap，net，nip，nut。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter p: most commonly says /p/. Examples: pan, pen, pig, pup.
tts.zh: 字母 p：最常见发音 /p/。例词：pan，pen，pig，pup。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母组合 qu 常见音 /kw/

tts.en: Letter qu: most commonly says /kw/. Examples: quit, quiz, quick, quack.
tts.zh: 字母 qu：最常见发音 /kw/。例词：quit，quiz，quick，quack。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母 r 常见音 /r/（美式卷舌）

tts.en: Letter r: most commonly says /r/. Examples: rag, red, rip, run.
tts.zh: 字母 r：最常见发音 /r/。例词：rag，red，rip，run。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter s: most commonly says /s/. Examples: sun, sip, sad, mess.
tts.zh: 字母 s：最常见发音 /s/。例词：sun，sip，sad，mess。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter t: most commonly says /t/. Examples: top, ten, tip, tub.
tts.zh: 字母 t：最常见发音 /t/。例词：top，ten，tip，tub。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter v: most commonly says /v/. Examples: van, vet, vivid, vote.
tts.zh: 字母 v：最常见发音 /v/。例词：van，vet，vivid，vote。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter w: most commonly says /w/. Examples: web, win, wet, wag.
tts.zh: 字母 w：最常见发音 /w/。例词：web，win，wet，wag。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter x: most commonly says /ks/. Examples: box, fox, six, mix.
tts.zh: 字母 x：最常见发音 /ks/。例词：box，fox，six，mix。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

sound.name_cn: 字母 y 作辅音时发 /j/（像 yes 开头）

tts.en: Letter y: most commonly says /j/. Examples: yes, yam, yell, yuck.
tts.zh: 字母 y：最常见发音 /j/。例词：yes，yam，yell，yuck。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Letter z: most commonly says /z/. Examples: zip, zag, zoo, buzz.
tts.zh: 字母 z：最常见发音 /z/。例词：zip，zag，zoo，buzz。

notes: Most common sound; English has additional sounds in later rules.

tts.en: Short vowel a: says /æ/ in closed syllables like CVC words. Examples: cat, map, sad, bag.
tts.zh: 短元音 a：在闭音节（如 CVC）里常读 /æ/。例词：cat，map，sad，bag。

notes: Common in CVC/closed syllables.

tts.en: Short vowel e: says /ɛ/ in closed syllables like CVC words. Examples: bed, hen, red, jet.
tts.zh: 短元音 e：在闭音节（如 CVC）里常读 /ɛ/。例词：bed，hen，red，jet。

notes: Common in CVC/closed syllables.

tts.en: Short vowel i: says /ɪ/ in closed syllables like CVC words. Examples: sit, pig, fin, lip.
tts.zh: 短元音 i：在闭音节（如 CVC）里常读 /ɪ/。例词：sit，pig，fin，lip。

notes: Common in CVC/closed syllables.

tts.en: Short vowel o: says /ɑ/ in closed syllables like CVC words. Examples: hot, mop, sock, lot.
tts.zh: 短元音 o：在闭音节（如 CVC）里常读 /ɑ/。例词：hot，mop，sock，lot。

notes: Common in CVC/closed syllables.

tts.en: Short vowel u: says /ʌ/ in closed syllables like CVC words. Examples: sun, cup, bug, mud.
tts.zh: 短元音 u：在闭音节（如 CVC）里常读 /ʌ/。例词：sun，cup，bug，mud。

notes: Common in CVC/closed syllables.

tts.en: Grapheme ch: says /tʃ/. Examples: chip, chop, chin, rich.
tts.zh: 字母组合 ch：常读 /tʃ/。例词：chip，chop，chin，rich。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

sound.name_cn: ck 常在词尾读 /k/（多跟短元音）

tts.en: Grapheme ck: says /k/. Examples: back, neck, kick, duck.
tts.zh: 字母组合 ck：常读 /k/。例词：back，neck，kick，duck。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme ng: says /ŋ/. Examples: sing, ring, long, king.
tts.zh: 字母组合 ng：常读 /ŋ/。例词：sing，ring，long，king。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme nk: says /ŋk/. Examples: sink, pink, bank, trunk.
tts.zh: 字母组合 nk：常读 /ŋk/。例词：sink，pink，bank，trunk。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme ph: says /f/. Examples: phone, photo, graph, elephant.
tts.zh: 字母组合 ph：常读 /f/。例词：phone，photo，graph，elephant。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme sh: says /ʃ/. Examples: ship, shop, fish, wish.
tts.zh: 字母组合 sh：常读 /ʃ/。例词：ship，shop，fish，wish。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme th: says /ð/. Examples: this, that, them, with.
tts.zh: 字母组合 th：常读 /ð/。例词：this，that，them，with。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme th: says /θ/. Examples: thin, thumb, bath, math.
tts.zh: 字母组合 th：常读 /θ/。例词：thin，thumb，bath，math。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

tts.en: Grapheme wh: says /w/. Examples: when, what, which, whip.
tts.zh: 字母组合 wh：常读 /w/。例词：when，what，which，whip。

notes: Digraph/trigraph: two or three letters making one sound.

sound.name_en: kn: k is silent; kn says /n/

tts.en: Silent letter pattern kn: says /n/. Examples: knee, knife, knot, knock.
tts.zh: 不发音字母规律 kn：整体读 /n/。例词：knee，knife，knot，knock。

notes: These are common patterns but not fully 'sound it out' by single letters.

sound.name_en: mb: b is silent at the end

tts.en: Silent letter pattern mb: says /m/. Examples: lamb, comb, thumb, climb.
tts.zh: 不发音字母规律 mb：整体读 /m/。例词：lamb，comb，thumb，climb。

notes: These are common patterns but not fully 'sound it out' by single letters.

sound.name_en: wr: w is silent; wr says /r/

tts.en: Silent letter pattern wr: says /r/. Examples: wrap, wren, wrong, wrist.
tts.zh: 不发音字母规律 wr：整体读 /r/。例词：wrap，wren，wrong，wrist。

notes: These are common patterns but not fully 'sound it out' by single letters.

sound.name_cn: 辅音连读（不合并成新音）

tts.en: Two-letter L-blends: both consonants are heard (e.g., bl, cl). Examples: blot, clap, flag, glad.
tts.zh: L-blends：两个辅音连读，两个音都要读出来（如 bl, cl）。 例词：blot，clap，flag，glad。

notes: A blend is not a new sound; you still hear each consonant.

sound.name_cn: 辅音连读（不合并成新音）

tts.en: Two-letter R-blends: both consonants are heard (e.g., br, tr). Examples: brag, crab, drop, trip.
tts.zh: R-blends：两个辅音连读，两个音都要读出来（如 br, tr）。 例词：brag，crab，drop，trip。

notes: A blend is not a new sound; you still hear each consonant.

sound.name_cn: 辅音连读（不合并成新音）

tts.en: S-blends: start with s + another consonant; both sounds are heard. Examples: stop, spin, skin, swim.
tts.zh: S-blends：以 s 开头再接一个辅音，两个音都要读出来。 例词：stop，spin，skin，swim。

notes: A blend is not a new sound; you still hear each consonant.

sound.name_cn: 辅音连读（不合并成新音）

tts.en: Three-letter blends: three consonants blend together; each sound is heard. Examples: thin, string, split, scrap.
tts.zh: 三辅音连读：三个辅音一起连读，每个音都能听见。 例词：thin，string，split，scrap。

notes: A blend is not a new sound; you still hear each consonant.

tts.en: Consonant-le: at the end of a word, consonant + le forms its own syllable (…-le). Examples: apple, little, candle, table.
tts.zh: 辅音+le：词尾的“辅音 + le”通常构成一个音节（…-le）。 例词：apple，little，candle，table。

tts.en: dge often comes after a short vowel at the end of a syllable/word. Examples: badge, edge, bridge, fudge.
tts.zh: dge 常出现在短元音后，表示 /dʒ/ 音。 例词：badge，edge，bridge，fudge。

tts.en: FLOSS rule: in many one-syllable words, f/l/s/z are doubled after a short vowel at the end. Examples: off, bell, hiss, fuzz.
tts.zh: FLOSS 规则：很多单音节词里，词尾的 f/l/s/z 在短元音后会双写。 例词：off，bell，hiss，fuzz。

tts.en: tch usually comes after a short vowel in one-syllable words. Examples: catch, match, pitch, notch.
tts.zh: tch 多出现在短元音后（常见于单音节词）。 例词：catch，match，pitch，notch。

tts.en: Silent-e (VCe): final e is silent and makes a say its long sound /eɪ/. Examples: cake, name, game, late.
tts.zh: 魔法E（VCe）：词尾 e 通常不发音，让 a 读长音 /eɪ/。例词：cake，name，game，late。

notes: VCe is also called a split digraph. There are exceptions (have, give, etc.).

tts.en: Silent-e (VCe): final e is silent and makes e say its long sound /iː/. Examples: gene, scene, these, theme.
tts.zh: 魔法E（VCe）：词尾 e 通常不发音，让 e 读长音 /iː/。例词：gene，scene，these，theme。

notes: VCe is also called a split digraph. There are exceptions (have, give, etc.).

tts.en: Silent-e (VCe): final e is silent and makes i say its long sound /aɪ/. Examples: bike, time, kite, nine.
tts.zh: 魔法E（VCe）：词尾 e 通常不发音，让 i 读长音 /aɪ/。例词：bike，time，kite，nine。

notes: VCe is also called a split digraph. There are exceptions (have, give, etc.).

tts.en: Silent-e (VCe): final e is silent and makes o say its long sound /oʊ/. Examples: home, nose, hope, rope.
tts.zh: 魔法E（VCe）：词尾 e 通常不发音，让 o 读长音 /oʊ/。例词：home，nose，hope，rope。

notes: VCe is also called a split digraph. There are exceptions (have, give, etc.).

tts.en: Silent-e (VCe): final e is silent and makes u say its long sound /juː/ or /uː/. Examples: cube, tune, mule, tube.
tts.zh: 魔法E（VCe）：词尾 e 通常不发音，让 u 读长音 /juː/ or /uː/。例词：cube，tune，mule，tube。

notes: VCe is also called a split digraph. There are exceptions (have, give, etc.).

tts.en: Vowel team ai: says /eɪ/. Examples: rain, tail, snail, paint.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ai：常读 /eɪ/。例词：rain，tail，snail，paint。

notes: Often in the middle of a word.

tts.en: Vowel team ay: says /eɪ/. Examples: day, play, stay, tray.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ay：常读 /eɪ/。例词：day，play，stay，tray。

notes: Often at the end of a word.

tts.en: Vowel team ea: says /iː/. Examples: meat, team, seal, eat.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ea：常读 /iː/。例词：meat，team，seal，eat。

notes: ea can also say /ɛ/ in some words (see separate rule).

tts.en: Vowel team ee: says /iː/. Examples: see, seed, feet, green.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ee：常读 /iː/。例词：see，seed，feet，green。

tts.en: Vowel team ie: says /aɪ/. Examples: pie, tie, lie, die.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ie：常读 /aɪ/。例词：pie，tie，lie，die。

notes: ie can also say /iː/ in some words (chief); teach as advanced/irregular.

tts.en: Vowel team igh: says /aɪ/. Examples: light, night, right, sigh.
tts.zh: 元音组合 igh：常读 /aɪ/。例词：light，night，right，sigh。

notes: gh is silent in this pattern.

tts.en: Vowel team oa: says /oʊ/. Examples: boat, coat, road, soap.
tts.zh: 元音组合 oa：常读 /oʊ/。例词：boat，coat，road，soap。

tts.en: Vowel team ow: says /oʊ/. Examples: snow, grow, low, show.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ow：常读 /oʊ/。例词：snow，grow，low，show。

notes: ow can also say /aʊ/ (see diphthong rule).

tts.en: R-controlled ar: says /ɑr/. Examples: car, far, barn, park.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 ar：常读 /ɑr/。例词：car，far，barn，park。

tts.en: R-controlled er: says /ɝ/. Examples: her, fern, term, perch.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 er：常读 /ɝ/。例词：her，fern，term，perch。

notes: In many American accents, er/ir/ur share the same sound /ɝ/.

tts.en: R-controlled ir: says /ɝ/. Examples: bird, girl, first, shirt.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 ir：常读 /ɝ/。例词：bird，girl，first，shirt。

notes: In many American accents, er/ir/ur share the same sound /ɝ/.

tts.en: R-controlled or: says /ɔr/. Examples: corn, fork, storm, porch.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 or：常读 /ɔr/。例词：corn，fork，storm，porch。

tts.en: R-controlled ur: says /ɝ/. Examples: fur, turn, curl, hurt.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 ur：常读 /ɝ/。例词：fur，turn，curl，hurt。

notes: In many American accents, er/ir/ur share the same sound /ɝ/.

tts.en: R-controlled wor: says /wɝ/. Examples: word, work, worm, world.
tts.zh: R 控制元音 wor：常读 /wɝ/。例词：word，work，worm，world。

notes: In many American accents, er/ir/ur share the same sound /ɝ/.

tts.en: Vowel team au: says /ɔː/. Examples: haul, autumn, launch, fault.
tts.zh: 元音组合 au：常读 /ɔː/。例词：haul，autumn，launch，fault。

tts.en: Vowel team aw: says /ɔː/. Examples: saw, paw, claw, yawn.
tts.zh: 元音组合 aw：常读 /ɔː/。例词：saw，paw，claw，yawn。

tts.en: Vowel team ea: says /ɛ/. Examples: bread, head, dead, sweat.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ea：常读 /ɛ/。例词：bread，head，dead，sweat。

notes: This spelling can have more than one sound in English; teach the common one here.

tts.en: Vowel team oi: says /ɔɪ/. Examples: coin, boil, soil, join.
tts.zh: 元音组合 oi：常读 /ɔɪ/。例词：coin，boil，soil，join。

tts.en: Vowel team oo: says /uː/. Examples: moon, food, room, soon.
tts.zh: 元音组合 oo：常读 /uː/。例词：moon，food，room，soon。

notes: This spelling can have more than one sound in English; teach the common one here.

tts.en: Vowel team oo: says /ʊ/. Examples: book, cook, look, good.
tts.zh: 元音组合 oo：常读 /ʊ/。例词：book，cook，look，good。

notes: This spelling can have more than one sound in English; teach the common one here.

tts.en: Vowel team ou: says /aʊ/. Examples: out, loud, sound, cloud.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ou：常读 /aʊ/。例词：out，loud，sound，cloud。

tts.en: Vowel team ow: says /aʊ/. Examples: cow, now, down, town.
tts.zh: 元音组合 ow：常读 /aʊ/。例词：cow，now，down，town。

notes: This spelling can have more than one sound in English; teach the common one here.

tts.en: Vowel team oy: says /ɔɪ/. Examples: boy, toy, joy, coy.
tts.zh: 元音组合 oy：常读 /ɔɪ/。例词：boy，toy，joy，coy。

context.en: Usually before e, i, or y.

tts.en: Soft c: c says /s/ Usually before e, i, or y. Examples: cent, city, cycle, rice.
tts.zh: 软音 c：c 读 /s/通常在 e/i/y 前。 例词：cent，city，cycle，rice。

notes: Same letter can have multiple sounds; context helps choose the right one.

context.en: Usually before e, i, or y.
Often before e, i, or y (and sometimes at the end as -ge).
context.zh: 常在 e/i/y 前（或词尾 -ge）。

tts.en: Soft g: g says /dʒ/ Often before e, i, or y (and sometimes at the end as -ge). Examples: gem, giraffe, gym, age.
tts.zh: 软音 g：g 读 /dʒ/常在 e/i/y 前（或词尾 -ge）。 例词：gem，giraffe，gym，age。

notes: Same letter can have multiple sounds; context helps choose the right one.

context.en: Often before e, i, or y (and sometimes at the end as -ge).
context.zh: 常在 e/i/y 前（或词尾 -ge）。

context.en: At the end of a word or syllable, y often says /iː/.
context.zh: 在词尾/音节尾，y 常读 /iː/。

sound.name_cn: 词尾 y（长 e 音）

tts.en: Final y often says /iː/ (like long e). Examples: happy, funny, sunny, baby.
tts.zh: 词尾 y 常读 /iː/（像长 e）。例词：happy，funny，sunny，baby。

notes: In some words, final y says /aɪ/ (see next rule).

context.en: At the end of a one-syllable word, y often says /aɪ/.
context.zh: 在单音节词尾，y 常读 /aɪ/。

sound.name_cn: 词尾 y（长 i 音）

tts.en: In many one-syllable words, final y says /aɪ/ (like long i). Examples: my, fly, try, sky.
tts.zh: 很多单音节词里，词尾 y 读 /aɪ/（像长 i）。例词：my，fly，try，sky。

context.en: In the middle of a word, y can say /ɪ/ (short i).
context.zh: 在词中间，y 有时读 /ɪ/（短 i）。

tts.en: Middle y can say /ɪ/ (short i). Examples: gym, myth, hymn, lynx.
tts.zh: 词中间的 y 有时读 /ɪ/（短 i）。例词：gym，myth，hymn，lynx。

notes: These are common but not fully predictable; treat as a useful pattern.

tts.en: -ed (past): pronounced /d/ after voiced sounds (except /d/). Examples: played, cleaned, called, rained.
tts.zh: 过去式 -ed：在浊辅音或元音后常读 /d/（不含 /d/）。 例词：played，cleaned，called，rained。

tts.en: -ed (past): pronounced /ɪd/ after /t/ or /d/. Examples: wanted, needed, folded, landed.
tts.zh: 过去式 -ed：在 /t/ 或 /d/ 后读 /ɪd/。 例词：wanted，needed，folded，landed。

tts.en: -ed (past): pronounced /t/ after voiceless sounds (except /t/). Examples: jumped, kissed, laughed, fixed.
tts.zh: 过去式 -ed：在清辅音后常读 /t/（不含 /t/）。 例词：jumped，kissed，laughed，fixed。

tts.en: -ing: shows an action happening now (present participle). Examples: jumping, running, looking, fishing.
tts.zh: -ing：表示正在进行的动作。 例词：jumping，running，looking，fishing。

tts.en: Plural -es: after s, x, z, ch, sh, add -es (usually /ɪz/). Examples: boxes, buses, dishes, watches.
tts.zh: 复数 -es：在 s/x/z/ch/sh 后加 -es（常读 /ɪz/）。 例词：boxes，buses，dishes，watches。

tts.en: Plural -s: adds meaning 'more than one' (pronounced /s/ or /z/ depending on the ending sound). Examples: cats, dogs, maps, hats.
tts.zh: 复数 -s：表示“多个”（读 /s/ 或 /z/，取决于前一个音）。 例词：cats，dogs，maps，hats。

notes: TTS/teaching can introduce /s/ vs /z/ later; the spelling pattern is stable.

tts.en: When a one-syllable word ends CVC (one vowel + one consonant), double the final consonant before adding a vowel suffix like -ing or -ed. Examples: hop→hopping, run→running, sit→sitting, plan→planning.
tts.zh: 单音节词若以 CVC 结尾（一个元音后跟一个辅音），加 -ing/-ed 等以元音开头的后缀时，常双写词尾辅音。例：hop→hopping，run→running，sit→sitting，plan→planning。

notes: Often taught as the 1-1-1 rule (one syllable, one vowel, one final consonant). Do not double w, x, y.

tts.en: If a base word ends with silent e, drop the e before adding a vowel suffix like -ing or -ed. Examples: make→making, ride→riding, hope→hoping, use→using.
tts.zh: 词根以不发音的 e 结尾时，加 -ing/-ed 等以元音开头的后缀通常先去掉 e。例：make→making，ride→riding，hope→hoping，use→using。

notes: Keep the e if the suffix starts with a consonant (e.g., hope→hopeful).

tts.en: If a word ends with consonant + y, change y to i before adding -es, -ed, -er, or -est. Examples: cry→cried, try→tries, happy→happier, carry→carried.
tts.zh: 词尾是“辅音 + y”时，加 -es/-ed/-er/-est 通常先把 y 变成 i。例：cry→cried，try→tries，happy→happier，carry→carried。

notes: If the word ends with vowel + y, keep y (play→played).

tts.en: A closed syllable ends in a consonant; the vowel is usually short. Examples: cat, basket, rabbit, sunset.
tts.zh: 闭音节：音节以辅音结尾，元音通常读短音。 例词：cat，basket，rabbit，sunset。

tts.en: Consonant + le at the end forms a syllable (…-le). Examples: table, apple, candle, turtle.
tts.zh: 词尾“辅音+le”构成一个音节（…-le）。 例词：table，apple，candle，turtle。

tts.en: An open syllable ends in a vowel; the vowel is usually long. Examples: me, go, hi, she.
tts.zh: 开音节：音节以元音结尾，元音通常读长音。 例词：me，go，hi，she。

tts.en: In an r-controlled syllable, the vowel is controlled by r. Examples: car, bird, corn, turn.
tts.zh: R 控制音节：元音受 r 影响，发音改变。 例词：car，bird，corn，turn。

tts.en: A VCe syllable has a silent e that makes the vowel long. Examples: cake, bike, rope, cube.
tts.zh: VCe（魔法E）音节：词尾 e 不发音，让元音读长音。 例词：cake，bike，rope，cube。

tts.en: A vowel team syllable contains two vowels working together. Examples: rain, boat, seed, moon.
tts.zh: 元音组合音节：两个元音一起表示一个元音音值。 例词：rain，boat，seed，moon。

sound.name_en: gn: g is often silent; gn says /n/

tts.en: Silent g in gn: In many words, gn says /n/. Examples: gnat, gnaw, sign, design.
tts.zh: gn 的弱/静音规则：很多词里 g 不发音，gn 读 /n/。例词：gnat，gnaw，sign，design。

notes: Common at the beginning of some words (gnat, gnaw) and in some words ending with -gn (sign, design).
Not consistent in every word (e.g., magnet, signal); treat as a pattern with exceptions.

sound.name_en: gh at the beginning: gh says /g/

tts.en: At the beginning of a word, gh usually says /g/. Examples: ghost, ghoul, ghast, gherkin.
tts.zh: 词首 gh 通常读 /g/。例词：ghost，ghoul，ghast，gherkin。

notes: This spelling is uncommon; mostly appears at the beginning of a word.

sound.name_en: gh can say /f/ in a small set of words

tts.en: In a small set of words, gh says /f/. Examples: laugh, rough, tough, enough.
tts.zh: 在少量词里，gh 读 /f/。例词：laugh，rough，tough，enough。

notes: This pattern is not very productive; best learned as a word list.
The vowel spellings in these words are irregular (e.g., -ough has multiple pronunciations).

context.en: Often before e, i, or y; the u is silent and keeps g hard.
context.zh: 常在 e/i/y 前；u 不发音，用来“保护”g 保持硬音。

sound.name_en: gu: u is silent; gu spells /g/

tts.en: Silent u in gu: The u is silent and keeps g saying /g/ before e or i. Examples: guess, guest, guide, guilt.
tts.zh: gu 的静音 u：u 不发音，用来让 g 在 e/i 前仍读 /g/。例词：guess，guest，guide，guilt。

notes: Many programs teach this as 'u protects g' so g does not become soft before e/i/y.
Not every gu word has a silent u (e.g., language); treat as a helpful pattern.

sound.name_cn: 非重读音节的 Schwa /ə/（弱读）

tts.en: Schwa: In an unstressed syllable, a vowel often sounds like the relaxed 'uh' sound, schwa. Any vowel letter can spell schwa. Examples: about, pencil, lemon, circus.
tts.zh: Schwa 弱读：在非重读音节里，元音常读成放松的“uh”音，也就是 /ə/。任何元音字母都可能表示 schwa。例词：about，pencil，lemon，circus。

notes: Schwa occurs in unstressed (unaccented) syllables; it's one of the most common vowel sounds.
Any vowel letter (a, e, i, o, u, y) can represent schwa, so decoding longer words often requires vocabulary support.

sound.name_cn: VCCCV：三个辅音夹在两个元音之间，优先保持常见复合辅音不被拆开

tts.en: Syllable division: VCCCV pattern. When three consonants are between two vowels, try to keep a common blend or digraph together. If the last two consonants form a blend like st, tr, gr, pl, divide after the first consonant: mon-ster, hun-dred. If not, divide after the second consonant: pump-kin. Do not split consonant digraphs like sh, ch, th.
tts.zh: 音节划分：VCCCV。两个元音之间有三个辅音时，优先让常见复合辅音（如 st、tr、gr、pl）保持在一起。如果后两个辅音能组成常见复合辅音，就在第一个辅音后切分：mon-ster，hun-dred。否则通常在第二个辅音后切分：pump-kin。并且不要拆分 sh、ch、th 这类辅音字母组合。

notes: Execution priority: check VCCCV before VCCV to avoid mis-parsing three-consonant clusters.
Heuristic: if C2+C3 is a common blend/digraph, prefer V C1 / C2C3 V; otherwise V C1C2 / C3 V.
This is a syllable-division strategy (concept rule), not a guaranteed pronunciation rule.

sound.name_en: VCCV: divide between the two consonants
sound.name_cn: VCCV：两个辅音夹在两个元音之间，通常从中间切分

tts.en: Syllable division: VCCV pattern. When two consonants are between two vowels, usually divide between the consonants. Do not split a consonant digraph like sh, ch, th; treat it as a VCV case.
tts.zh: 音节划分：VCCV。两个元音之间有两个辅音时，通常在两个辅音之间切分。注意：像 sh、ch、th 这类 digraph 不要拆开，遇到它更像 VCV 的情况处理。

notes: Source-aligned heuristic used in common phonics programs: VCCV → VC/CV (two closed syllables).
Exception: if the two consonants form a digraph (one sound), do NOT split them.

sound.name_en: VCV: try V/CV first, then VC/V
sound.name_cn: VCV：先试 V/CV（开音节），不通再试 VC/V（闭音节）

tts.en: Syllable division: VCV pattern. With one consonant between vowels, first try dividing after the first vowel (V/CV), like o-pen. If that doesn't make a real word, try dividing after the consonant (VC/V), like cab-in.
tts.zh: 音节划分：VCV。两个元音中间只有一个辅音时，先试在第一个元音后切分（V/CV，例如 o-pen）。如果读不通，再试在辅音后切分（VC/V，例如 cab-in）。

notes: This is a decoding strategy (try both), not a 100% deterministic rule.
Often V/CV gives an open first syllable (long vowel); VC/V gives a closed first syllable (short vowel).

sound.name_cn: 辅音+le：在 le 前面的辅音处切分

tts.en: Syllable division: consonant-le. If a word ends with consonant plus L-E, divide right before that consonant: ta-ble, lit-tle, bum-ble, can-dle.
tts.zh: 音节划分：辅音+le。单词末尾出现“辅音 + le”时，就在这个辅音前切分：ta-ble，lit-tle，bum-ble，can-dle。

notes: The -le ending forms its own syllable (C-le).
Common teaching tip: count back three from the end and divide.

sound.name_en: Compound words: split between the two words
sound.name_cn: 复合词：在两个词之间切分

tts.en: Syllable division: compound words. If a long word is made of two smaller words, divide between the words: sun-set, rain-bow, base-ball, playground.
tts.zh: 音节划分：复合词。如果一个长词由两个小词组成，就在两个词的边界切分：sun-set，rain-bow，base-ball，playground。

notes: Look for two meaningful smaller words inside the long word.
This often corresponds to a clear syllable boundary.

sound.name_en: Prefixes and suffixes: divide at morpheme boundaries
sound.name_cn: 前缀/后缀：按词根边界切分

tts.en: Syllable division: prefixes and suffixes. When you see a common prefix or suffix, divide at that boundary: re-play, un-happy, help-less, hope-ful.
tts.zh: 音节划分：前缀/后缀。看到常见前缀或后缀时，可以在词根边界切分：re-play，un-happy，help-less，hope-ful。

notes: This helps decoding and also connects to meaning.
Not every split is a perfect syllable boundary, but it is a strong starting point.

sound.name_en: VV: sometimes split between the vowels (hiatus)
sound.name_cn: 双元音字母：少数词会在两个元音字母之间分开读（hiatus）

tts.en: Syllable division: two vowels together. Most of the time, two vowels act as one vowel team (one sound). But in some words, the vowels split into two syllables, like di-et, po-em, li-on, re-act.
tts.zh: 音节划分：两个元音字母连在一起时，多数情况是一个元音组合（只发一个元音）。但也有少数词会拆成两个音节，例如 di-et，po-em，li-on，re-act。

notes: Mark as lower productivity: this is a small set of words; avoid over-generalizing.
Useful for decoding words like diet/poem/lion where both vowels are heard separately.

sound.name_cn: S 在某些环境下读 /z/（浊化）

tts.en: Voicing: the letter S is often voiced to /z/ when it is between two vowels, or before an M. Examples: mu-sic, pri-son, rea-son, ri-se. This is common but not universal.
tts.zh: 清浊变化：字母 s 在两个元音之间（或在 m 前）时，常读作浊音 /z/。例词：mu-sic，pri-son，rea-son，ri-se。注意：这是常见倾向，但不是百分之百。

notes: Teaching note in several phonics/spelling programs: s between two vowels often says /z/ (and sometimes before m).
Mark as 'often' not always; there are exceptions (e.g., basic).
